div.p: M89/11833, unit 611, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 1st October 1889

I have the honor to solicit, that you will kindly permit me to engage two youths for 4 days a week at a remuneration of 3 shillings and 4 shillings per day respectively, during the months of October, November and December, payment to be rendered out of the vote for Contingencies.

Their services in the past have proved very useful in relieving the permanent officers of much mechanical work at a comparatively small cost.
See M to A. Deakin, 25 June 1889. Deakin approved M's request on 2 October 1889; M was informed and replied on 9 October 'with best thanks'. The Under Secretary, T. Wilson, also forwarded Deakin's approval to the Commissioners of Audit for their information on 10 October.
See also M to A. Deakin, 23 December 1889.
